Question.Subject: WPA2-PSK to WEP??? help please!!?
Question.Content: so i bought a d-link router and recently found out that the key type it is using is WPA2-PSK... which my nds cannot read... (my nds reads WEP keys only...) so i cant use the wifi... does anyone know how to convert WPA2-PSK to WEP? please help :D
Question.ChosenAnswer:
There is nothing wrong with your router and you can change security settings from WPA to WEP. I think ( Wi-Fi Protected Access) WPA2-PSK is default security setting in your d-link router,check through the SET UP configuration in your router and change security from WPA2 to WEP.
have a nice time.

Answer.Content:
There is nothing wrong with your router and you can change security settings from WPA to WEP. I think ( Wi-Fi Protected Access) WPA2-PSK is default security setting in your d-link router,check through the SET UP configuration in your router and change security from WPA2 to WEP.
have a nice time.
